name: endothermic
content:

taking place or being formed by absorbing heat: endothermic reaction In an endothermic reaction, the temperature of the surroundings decreases. Melting, evaporation and boiling are endothermic processes. Benzene is an example of an endothermic compound. Is the overall reaction exothermic or endothermic? Compare
exothermic
More examplesFewer examplesChemical reactions which absorb energy from the surroundings are described as endothermic. This gives a mixture of carbon monoxide and hydrogen in an endothermic reaction.The decomposition of hydrogen iodide is an endothermic reaction.Bond breaking is endothermic and bond forming is exothermic.
